page.title: 13Schools in Monmouth 1
page.content: { Monmouth School}was founded in 1614 by William Jones, a merchant banker and through him the{Worshipful Company {of Haberdashers}whose generous endowment still today helps provide excellent facilities.The{school}is {independent}for day and{boarding students, some of whom benefit from the assisted places scheme.Normal entry is at 11 years, and an annexe {"The Grange"}provides{preparatory {education}for 80 pupils 7-11 years.Lower school is 11-16 years and Upper school 16-18 years.Older boys participate in a prefect system. For dayboys the{fee}is #2094 p.a. and for boarders #3867 p.a.There are 43 assistant{masters,}a{music}dept.of 12, and house staff.The headmaster is assisted by a second master.Much emphasis is placed on{sport}including rowing.
